pr_title: DHFPROD-4904:Run load step with selected files

timeline.bodyText: No need to change, but you can do these 2 lines in 1 line - loginAsTestUserWithRoles.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: I think we need to verify that the two JSON documents were ingested as well. This is good in that it verifies no error occurred, but it should be a simple matter to verify that the two documents are in the staging database too - I imagine you can assert on the size of the collection that the documents were ingested into.
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: runFlow() starts the job and returns , so had to include a function to check for completion of job and verified if the docs were ingested.
replies.author: srinathgit

timeline.message: DHFPROD-4904:Run load step with selected files

timeline.bodyText:
This is a common problem we have, which is obtaining a reference to the FlowRunner so we can call awaitCompletion instead of having to write a lot of code here, or subclass NewFlowController.
Here's a better approach - add a "private Consumer flowRunnerConsumer" to NewFlowController (and can you actually rename that to FlowController too? I forgot to do so before). Add a public setter for it.
If flowRunnerConsumer is non-null, then call accept on it after running the flow.
That way, a test can obtain the Autowired FlowController and then pass in a Consumer impl so it'll get a reference to the FlowRunner. The impl of Consumer can then call awaitCompletion.
timeline.author: rjrudin
